item.title: Bins not in use attracting vermin, 13th July
item.description:
These buns are not attached to a residence or being used. They’re being filled by passer-by’s and are not being emptied. They have been full for months. The smell is very bad and there are rats and foxes all over them. Please can the bins be taken away.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Friary Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electric bike zooming by way to fast, 13th July
item.description:
This footpath is very dangerous specially with younger kids. Electric bike use this as a road and go way too fast. You should install barriers force them to stop/break their speed. I witness a near miss today, an accident is bound happen

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Church Path, Highbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping and not disposing of rubbish correctly, 13th July
item.description:
Its been reported numerous of times that people around hill view drive keep and William Newman court keep dumping their bulky household furniture and garden waste in the alleyway or in our communal bin area. Today a particular couple of hill view drive who have just moved out today have been witnessed dumping their household furniture into our communal bin area not even in the bin they were asked by 2 people who live here to take their rubbish to the dump an they of course lied and left their furniture in our communal bin area which then stops the bins being collected and people think it is acceptable to dump all number of things into the bin area. This causes issues for people in wheelchairs because the rubbish has blocked people accessing the bins. The furniture has now been moved to outside of the property so that the bin men can change our bins otherwise they refuse and this can cause maggots and flies. there are two alleyway the one where the bins get collected and also the other side where people live and the man on the ground floor is in a wheel chair cannot use the alleyway because he cannot get past. There needs to be a better solution for the bin area because people use this sneakily at night time dumping all sorts of rubbish and bulky household items and residents of the area have to clean it because otherwise bins wont get taken and people cant dispose of rubbish correctly. There are two entrances to it and this needs to be resolved once and for all, maybe give people fobs so they we know only people of the block can use the bins, there needs to be cameras so that fly tipping can be reported and people dealt with correctly way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: DEAD CAT IN BUSH In front of 41 Swift House, Albert Road, London, NW65BW, 13th July
item.description:
Found a dead cat inside a bush in front of 41 Swift House, Albert Road, London, NW65BW. This cat looks really young like around 3 years old and had died today Sunday 13/07/2025. Please kindly collect this dead cat thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Albert Road, London

item.category: Street cleaning - Dead animal on street

item.title: Drain completely blocked, 13th July
item.description:
This drain was completely covered to the extent you wouldn't realise it was there. I cleared as much as I could, but then discovered the actual drain is blocked solid with dirt etc and I'm unable to lift the grating to clear it any further. At rear of 3 Sedgewood Close BR2 7QL

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickhurst Green, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Craig's Court alleyway - full if cigarete buds crushed glass and worse, 13th July
item.description:
Employees from Great Scotland Yard Hotel - instead of smoking outside their hotel - despite numerous polite requests from the residential block - keep on smoking and drinking and littering - cigarette buds etc... outside residential entrance. Can the council please fine them for littering and request they smoke away from the residential entrance - why are they allowed to subject the residential flats above to 2nd hand smoking, pavement obstruction and not to mention making the street even more filthy than usual!?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Whitehall, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree was allowed to grow to wide, 13th July
item.description:
